Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Kinetic sieving in micropores, facilitated diffusion in mesopores

Other Information.Additional Info: Fast adsorption process observed with diffusion time constant of 4.13*10^-2 s^-1.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Two-step diffusion behavior (fast step in mesopores, slow step in micropores)

Other Information.Additional Info: Diffusion time constants for fast step: 8.39*10^-2 s^-1; slow step: 3.31*10^-5 s^-1.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with facilitated transport through mesopores

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiments, gas adsorption isotherms, and kinetic measurements
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C3H6 uptake: 2.90 mmol g^-1 at 100 kPa; C3H8 uptake: 2.16 mmol g^-1 at 100 kPa

Other Information.Additional Info: MCC-meso-1 exhibits high mechanical strength and excellent stability under harsh conditions.
One-step fast adsorption process with diffusion time constant of 1.26*10^-2 s^-1.
Suppressed diffusion observed due to lack of mesopores.

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas adsorption isotherms and kinetic measurements
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C3H6 uptake: Not explicitly reported; C3H8 uptake suppressed

Other Information.Additional Info: Lower mechanical strength compared to MCC-meso-1.
